source.absolute_timeline_notes: Immediately after Skree’s VR exfil sequence; in-facility incubation room and Fay’s quarters.

text_windows.full_scene_clean: Li Mei entered the incubation room, cane’s silver tip tapping the polished floor. Technicians cleaned the recently decanted incubation tank. Skree lay unconscious in a transport chamber, washed and dressed to match her VR exit, bruise and all. “Is she ready?” Li Mei asked, eyes on Fay. “All but the cred chip we’re implanting,” Fay said. An aide handed Fay a small plastic case. “Stop!” Li Mei snapped, slamming the cane tip. Fay withdrew her hand; the original case had slipped into a pocket fold via sleight-of-hand. “I was just getting the injector tool,” she said. “Don’t move.” An aide retrieved from Fay’s pocket an injector and a second case. “Inject the chip,” Li Mei ordered a different aide. “Use our injector, not hers.” The aide opened the plain case, inserted the chip, and clicked it into Skree’s wrist. A scan flashed green. Fay smirked inwardly: the chip was a perfect forgery carrying the right credentials plus her hidden payload, prepared earlier by siphoning the real chip’s data. “Good,” Li Mei said. “Package her for courier to Broken Bow Free City. Handlers will take over; the chip funds basics but forces her to work. No transmissions out, and absolutely no contact with the asset.” The dolly rolled Skree away. Techs finished sanitizing the pod and floor. Four orderlies escorted Fay back toward her lab. Hands in pockets, Fay fingered a hidden button-sized 1 cm box, savoring the con. She accessed a jump node via Utility Chiller 13 to check a honeypot laid for Randy’s sister—two active pings. “Gotcha,” she whispered. With Li Mei busy, Fay planned to move. In her quarters, the door sealed. Lights dimmed gold. A dojo tri-D feed flickered: her “gladiators” stretching, hex-patterned skin gleaming. A maintenance cart drone crawled above in a service tunnel ferrying doom on a timer; code release: Status—OK. Seven hundred meters. Six minutes, twenty-eight seconds. System monitors showed clean relays from waste and overhead duct repeaters. Nude, Fay settled on a leather couch, switched to full tri-D immersion, and started a recorder wired to processors and storage embedded in her body. Her favorite fighter’s optical processor carried her ephemeral malware, planted via his shave-cam weeks earlier. A countdown scrolled; at zero, barely perceptible light flicker would trigger the code. Everything in motion.
text_windows.dense_recap_250w: In a sterile incubation room, Li Mei supervises the implantation and verification of Skree’s ident/cred chip while suspecting Fay of sleight-of-hand. She thwarts an immediate swap by ordering her own injector used and having aides retrieve items from Fay’s pocket. However, Fay had previously cloned and re-flashed the real chip’s data, ensuring the chip now embedded in Skree is a convincing forgery carrying her clandestine payload. Li Mei outlines the operational plan: Skree will be couriered to Broken Bow Free City with enough holos to survive but not thrive, monitored by agents and steered by handlers; no transmissions or contact with the asset are allowed. Skree is rolled away, the pod is sanitized, and orderlies escort Fay out. En route and then in her private quarters, Fay confirms covert infrastructure: a jump-node via Utility Chiller 13, a live honeypot baiting Randy’s sister, clean status pings from a waste relay and duct repeater, and a maintenance cart drone on a timed course to deliver an unspecified payload. She also readies a parallel exploit against her favorite dojo “gladiator,” whose optical processor carries self-erasing malware planted earlier via a shave-mirror camera; a subtle light pattern will trigger the code. Fay initiates full tri-D immersion and internal recording with hardware embedded in her body, relishing her layered manipulations while everything moves toward timed execution.
text_windows.query_handle: Li Mei oversees Skree’s chip implant; Fay’s forgery passes verification; Fay spins up honeypot, drone timer, and optical-malware exploit.

narrative_beats.label: Incubation room audit
narrative_beats.what_happens: Li Mei confronts Fay’s sleight-of-hand during chip implantation and forces use of house injector.
narrative_beats.stakes_or_conflict: Control of Skree’s identity token; trust vs. subterfuge.

narrative_beats.label: Forgery confirmed
narrative_beats.what_happens: Scanner reads green; Fay’s earlier cloned-and-reflashed ident payload is now in Skree’s wrist.

narrative_beats.label: Deployment plan
narrative_beats.what_happens: Li Mei orders Skree couriered to Broken Bow under handlers with limited funds; comms lockdown imposed.

narrative_beats.label: Fay’s parallel ops
narrative_beats.what_happens: Fay checks jump node, confirms honeypot pings for Randy’s sister, and monitors clean relay paths.
narrative_beats.stakes_or_conflict: Stealth and misdirection to avoid Li Mei’s scrutiny.

narrative_beats.label: Timed triggers
narrative_beats.what_happens: Maintenance drone moves with a timed payload; dojo gladiator’s optical malware awaits light-trigger execution while Fay records in tri-D.
narrative_beats.stakes_or_conflict: Covert sabotage and voyeuristic control sync to countdowns.

metadata_for_indexing.keywords_dense: Li Mei incubation room, Skree ident chip implant, forged chip payload, wrist scan green, sleight-of-hand injector swap, Broken Bow Free City handlers, comms lockdown, Utility Chiller 13 jump node, honeypot Randy’s sister, maintenance cart drone countdown, dojo gladiator optical malware, tri-D immersion and internal recording, hex-pattern skin, astringent sterilization

qa_pairs.q: How does Li Mei try to prevent Fay’s tampering during the implant?
qa_pairs.a: She orders aides to retrieve Fay’s items and uses the facility’s own injector to implant the chip.

qa_pairs.q: Why does Fay’s forged chip still pass verification?
qa_pairs.a: Fay previously cloned the real chip’s data and reflashed it into a perfect forgery with a hidden payload.

qa_pairs.q: Where is Skree being sent after implantation?
qa_pairs.a: To Broken Bow Free City under handler supervision with limited funds.

qa_pairs.q: What timed operations does Fay set in motion?
qa_pairs.a: A maintenance cart drone carrying a payload on a countdown and a light-triggered, self-erasing optical exploit against a dojo fighter.

embedding_payloads.text: Li Mei supervises Skree’s ident/cred chip implantation, blocks Fay’s obvious swap, and orders Skree couriered to Broken Bow under handlers with comms lockdown. Despite procedural controls, Fay’s earlier data-clone means the implanted chip is a forged carrier for her hidden payload. Escorted away, Fay quietly checks a covert jump node, confirms honeypot hits for Randy’s sister, arms a maintenance drone’s timed run, and prepares a light-triggered exploit in a dojo fighter’s optical processor while recording in full tri-D with hardware embedded in her body.

Key actors: Li Mei (controller), Fay (manipulator/engineer), Skree (unconscious asset), aides/orderlies (procedural support), handler network (offstage), dojo gladiator (malware target). Tech: ident/cred chip, house injector, wrist scanner, Utility Chiller 13 jump node, honeypot for Randy’s sister, maintenance cart drone with timer, waste relay and duct repeater paths, optical processor malware, internal tri-D recorder. Places: incubation room, facility corridor, Fay’s quarters, dojo, overhead service tunnel.

Third-limited, gritty techno-noir with clinical detail and sardonic interiority. Dominant themes: control vs. agency, identity manipulation, surveillance, and hubristic seduction of power. Motifs: cane taps, green verifier light, countdowns, hex-pattern skin, sanitized floors, and hidden payloads. Moral tension centers on whether engineered ‘care’ and staged choices are indistinguishable from coercion.
